title: Waste-to-Value and Low-Carbon Infrastructure Leader Nexus PMG Raises $50 Million to Accelerate Its Services and ... - PR Newswire
summary: Nexus PMG, a company focused on low-carbon infrastructure, has secured $25 million in funding to expand its services business and develop greenfield and brownfield assets across North America. The company specializes in helping investors and developers navigate the complex world of waste-to-value projects, particularly in renewable natural gas and sustainable aviation fuel production. This investment will allow Nexus PMG to develop assets that reduce carbon emissions and contribute to the global energy transition.
product_or_process: Renewable Natural Gas, Sustainable Aviation Fuel, Compost Products, Biochar

greenwashing: The article does not suggest that Nexus PMG's practices are greenwashing; instead, it emphasizes their focus on developing low-carbon infrastructure and reducing environmental impact.

title: Antioxidant-packed GM purple tomatoes get FDA green light - AgFunderNews
summary: Norfolk Plant Sciences (NPS) has received regulatory clearance from both the FDA and USDA for its purple tomatoes genetically engineered to have high levels of anthocyanins. NPS is now ready to launch these tomatoes in the US, starting with a soft launch of fresh purple tomatoes and seeds for home gardeners. The company believes this innovation will provide consumers with a nutritious and flavorful tomato with extended shelf life.
